Legal_Issue: Whether Apotex's Notice of Allegation (NOA) sufficiently addresses non-infringement and invalidity claims
Evidence_Assessment: Apotex's NOA did not address the possibility of an in situ subcoating; relied on incorrect patent construction
Decision_Outcome: NOA declared insufficient; issuance of Notice of Compliance prohibited until patent expiration
Burden_of_Proof: On Apotex to justify non-infringement and invalidity allegations in NOA
Credibility_Factor: Apotex failed to raise all relevant issues in NOA, limiting credibility of expanded arguments
Legal_Rule: NOA must provide detailed legal and factual basis for non-infringement or invalidity allegations
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard in judicial review context
Procedural_Issue: Issue estoppel and abuse of process due to previous litigation
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-infringement based on absence of subcoating; invalidity of AstraZenecaâ€™s patent
Outcome_on_Merits: Apotex's allegations not justified; NOA found deficient
Review_Standard: Judicial review of administrative decision under PM(NOC) Regulations
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Apotex restricted to arguments raised in NOA; no expansion allowed
Key_Evidence_Considered: Text of Apotex's NOA; prior litigation findings; patent claims
Applicant_Challenge: AstraZeneca challenged sufficiency of Apotex's NOA
Court_Result: Declaration that NOA insufficient; prohibition on NOC issuance
Defendant_Response: Apotex alleged non-infringement and invalidity in NOA
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (NOA, patent documents, prior court decisions)
Remedy_Requested: Declaration of insufficiency; injunction against NOC issuance
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of generic market entry until patent expiry
Legal_Provision: Sections 5 and 6 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations, sections 5(1), 6(1)
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to fully address infringement and validity grounds in NOA
